# Resources
Here you find documentation on how to use the Facebook Conversion API.
### How to get your API token
### [üé• Watch video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMm58tWxZ-A )
### [üì∞ Read Official Guide](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api/get-started )
### Facebook API Explorer
### [üîç Open Explorer](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer/?method=POST&path=%7BYOUR_PIXEL_ID_HERE%7D%2Fevents&version=v20.0&data= [%0A%20%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%22event_name%22%3A%20%22Purchase%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%22event_time%22%3A%201727700999%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%22event_source_url%22%3A%20%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.example.com%2Fthank_you%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%22action_source%22%3A%20%22website%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%22user_data%22%3A%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22em%22%3A%20%227629d047f95fdad7cdb34786a032289b50c2d56298a9eb7a458d9cf05b53e487%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22ph%22%3A%20%22673c13f6157846da67b7254fc33064ecdd3244919a87091a3f6fc9dfdfc5fd5e%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22fn%22%3A%20%225cc6d27e226b37db0f02a940977559bf0131f826f6185a8f451f3714d128d00f%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22ln%22%3A%20%229289b8b41c61b83a78ce0e579f861957df776150ce43c6d5d8572f61cf68e33f%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22fbc%22%3A%20%22fb.1.1554763741205.AbCdEfGhIjKlMnOpQrStUvWxYz1234567890%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22fbp%22%3A%20%22fb.1.1596403881668.1116446470%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22client_ip_address%22%3A%20%22168.212.226.204%22%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22client_user_agent%22%3A%20%22Mozilla%2F5.0%20(Windows%20NT%2010.0%3B%20Win64%3B%20x64)%22%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%22custom_data%22%3A%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22value%22%3A%20127.9%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%22currency%22%3A%20%22USD%22%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%7D%0A]&test_event_code=TEST49670)
### API Reference for the Conversions API
### https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/using-the-api 
### See all allowed parameters here:
### https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters

## Data normalization
Every parameter has very strict formatting rules that must be followed.
Name, email, phone number etc.
You can learn more [**here**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters #em).

## Data encryption
After the data is normalized, it has to be encrypted using SHA256.
Some parameters need encryption, while others shouldn't be encrypted at all.
You can learn more [**here**](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters #em).

## Test event
There's a TEST CODE you can get from the Facebook Events Manager to send test events.
You should write your test code in the *test_event_code* parameter, at the end of the JSON.
Use that to test your events. After everything is working, remove the *test_event_code* parameter so that your events become official.
Learn more [**here**](https://business.facebook.com/business/help/2040882565969969 )

## Example data
You should find a way to receive all this data in your n8n workflow.
You can use webhook, database, API... Whatever you need to bring this data in.

## You don't have the fbp?
Use this node instead
The `fbp` is reliable for identifying a user session, so in the absence of a real fbclid, relying on fbp generally contributes more to accurate tracking.

## What if I don't have the fbc ?
If you don‚Äôt have a `facebook_click_id` (or if the user wasn‚Äôt driven by a Facebook ad), you can erase the `fbc`.
`fbc` is only valuable when it contains an actual fbclid from a Facebook ad click.
If you don‚Äôt have a genuine `fbclid` (from a real click), generating a fbc won't improve tracking ‚Äî it may even worsen the attribution.
